node.title: 'A bookshop is your friend': Magic of Meg's Bookshop still delights this South Australian town
node.alt: a man holds a book inside a bookshop
node.description: A much-loved bookshop has been a centrepiece on Port Pirie's main drag for more than 30 years, providing locals and visitors alike with the special magic a bookshop offers.
node.content:
["More than\u00a0a decade ago, predictions were made about the end of independent bookshops.", "Ebook readers were purchased and it seemed as if the end of the physical book was nigh.", "Mark and Margie Arnold, owners of Meg's Bookshop, were only slightly worried.", "Despite vacant\u00a0shopfronts\u00a0surrounding them on Port Pirie's main drag, Meg's Bookshop has been a mainstay through e-books, audiobooks and the internet.", "Margie grew up in her parents' corner shop in the lead smelting town\u00a0\u2014 it's where she learnt to connect with customers.", "", "
A gift\u00a0to Margie and Mark Arnold from Margie's brother hangs in the corner of their shop.\u00a0(ABC North and West SA: Georgia Roberts)
", "She says the corner store influenced her in her decision to open the doors to Meg's Bookshop 30 years ago.", "That, and her brother's love of books.", "She used to catch him reading almost everywhere.", "\"It really annoyed me how much he read,\" Margie says.", "Although\u00a0she found the habit questionable, Margie eventually became a book lover herself.", "Nestled in the back corner of her bookstore is a plaque given to her by her brother that says: \"When you feel you are breaking into little pieces, go to your favourite bookstore and take comfort in all the wonderful books.\"", "", "
Meg's Bookshop has dedicated an area to\u00a0First Nations authors.\u00a0(ABC North and West SA: Georgia Roberts)
", "
'They become family'
", "Mark\u00a0and Margie have hosted book launches for local authors and they've provided a bookselling service to a large swathe of regional South Australia.", "It has captivated bibliophiles who wouldn't usually be able to access some of their favourite tomes without travelling hours to the city.", "", "
A young book lover happy with her purchase at Meg's Bookshop in Port Pirie.\u00a0(ABC North and West SA: Georgia Roberts)
", "\"People that have come into the shop have known us forever and they've become family,\" she says.", "How has their independent bookshop in a small regional city lasted in the age of the internet? Mark says it's simple.", "\"We're stubborn.", "\"It's not as if it's always been easy, we've had to watch cash flow like any retail store.\"", "", "
Margie and Mark Arnold have owned Meg's Bookshop in Port Pirie for 30 years.\u00a0(ABC North and West SA: Georgia Roberts)
", "
For the love of books
", "Robbie Egan modelled his MBA around the topic of the independent bookshop.", "He's also the CEO of the Australian Booksellers Association, based in Melbourne.", "", "
Robbie Egan, CEO of the Australian Booksellers Assosciation.\u00a0(Supplied: Robbie Egan)
", "An expert on the topic, Mr Egan displays the kind of passion for bookshops you only see in those that truly love them.", "\"Bookshops just aren't there to consume product,\" he says", "\"We create places where people go to be enlightened, it's a unique space.", "Mr Egan says the pandemic\u00a0has forced a lot of independent booksellers online.", "He says the move was expected and probably needed.", "\"The online space is simply another manifestation of our resilience and flexibility.\"", "\"We stand poised to benefit from the increased interest in books, Covid pushed people back to books.\"", "\"We could be entering a real golden age of independent bookselling.\" Mr Egan says.", "
Books are back
", "Even on a school day, Meg's Bookshop is bustling with children.", "Mark and Margie serve them all with a smile.", "\"The rise of ebooks was exaggerated and customers have stuck with us through it all.\"", "While ebook sales aren't on the increase, online book purchases have remained a threat but Mark says he's not worried.", "", "
Two children picking up new books at their local bookshop.\u00a0(ABC North and West SA: Georgia Roberts)
", "Books are back in vogue, or perhaps they never really left.", "\"Ten\u00a0years ago it was a problem, people don't think about it now if they want a book they buy a book,\" Mark says.", "\"The people who follow fashion trends have decided books are back in.\""]
